website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G isn't the sharpest 50mm lens that we've tested, but it still offers excellent image quality at a modest price.
cons: No vibration reduction or aperture ring

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performance for little money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased locally due to wanting to take for niece's son's 3rd b-day party today. Bought yesterday! So far, love the quality of the images on my d7100 with this lens. Initial impression is solid performance and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: NYRFanSTL

customer_reviews.title: One of the BEST lenses for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first lens. This is pretty much the best lens for the money that you can buy when starting out. I still use this lens today. It is very sharp and super quick. The bokeh that it renders is really creamy. As with most nikon lenses, this is very well made and offers a really sharp picture. Initially you'll find yourself wanting to shoot at 1.8 during every shot. Really good for low light situations. Overall I can't recommend a better priced vs quality lens for beginners or even vets for that matter. I highly recommend this lens. Superb!
customer_reviews.author: Keyser RevealTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Needs This Lens!!
customer_reviews.text: As a photography amateur, I was looking for a trusty, multi-use lens that could give me blurry backgrounds and that always sought after "bokeh" effect. That is exactly what I got with this lens! My pictures are more crisp and detailed than I could have ever imagined. I would definitely recommend this lens to anyone who is new to DSLR photography and wants to build up their lens collection. As a side note, I use this lens with a Nikon d3300.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great value - sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a DX camera body for outdoor use mainly (35mm DX f/1.8 is more suited for indoors). This is effectively a 75mm lens for me - but without ANY edge artifacts due to it being an FX lens. This thing is super fast and sharp. A lot of the reviews here stated that the f/1.4 does not offer enough advantages to warrant the price and I do not regret this lens. Incredible value for something that I can keep as I upgrade in the future.
customer_reviews.author: hw_engineerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens I purchased to use with my D700
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens I purchased to use with my D700. Pictures come out crystal clear bright and vivid even in low light. Must buy for Nikon FX owners.
customer_reviews.author: deewane

customer_reviews.title: Love this. I am still learning this lens but ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I am still learning this lens but one tip I can share to those who do portraits and using a prime lens that opens this wide for the 1st time. Everything doesn't need to be shot at the highest stop of (1.8). If you shoot at this you will notice only a small part will be sharp and in focus. Portraits with this lens work best between 2.8 -5 standing at least arms length awayyou will get the whole face sharp instead of the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have Prime Lens
customer_reviews.text: Sharpness everywhere, beautiful contrast, fast auto focus, smooth and creamy bokeh wide open, good low-lighting performance, that's what you get when shooting with this lens. This is my favorite lens by far, everything just looks great. Perfect for portraits and close-up pictures but can be used in a lot of other situations. The only down-point is that sometimes 50 mm is too close for some shots, even if you step back, sometimes you screw with your composition, but this only happens if you want to take a picture of a large subject or a landscape, which is not the purpose of this lens for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Pinheiro de Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Best lens you can buy for a amateur
customer_reviews.text: My favorite lens that I own. I'm always shocked at how awesome my pictures come out with this lens. I use a d5100 so nothing even close to top of the line but i'm still able to get a great picture in lots of different light situations. If you have a nikon and want something more than what came with the camera this is the first lens i would tell you to buy. Attached is a picture i took with the lens on my d5100
customer_reviews.author: BDM

customer_reviews.title: This is an Excelent lens!
customer_reviews.text: I use a Nikon D3200 and have had this lens for about two years and it is one of my favorite lenses! this and my 35mm 1.8. I honestly believe everyone should learn photography with prime lenses, It helps you as a photographer to find really great compositions by having to move around a lot more. And having that wide aperture is a really big plus! This lens is really great for portraiture and shooting video! The auto focus is fast with its Silent Wave Motor, and you can manually adjust the focus while in Auto/Manuel focus. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for high school/college basketball
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional sports photographer and this is great for shots around the rim in basketball. Autofocus is fast enough to get by using an enthusiast-level body (D7100, etc) but works flawless with a D500. Would recommend for somebody looking for a fast aperture at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Takes amazing shots. You must give it a try
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Lens in December 2016, but I got the first chance to test it out this past weekend during my trip to Sleeping Bear Dunes, MI. I'm not a professional photographer and I don't know much about photography--I like to take photos whenever I get a chance. I consider myself a beginner photographer and I still have a lot to learn, so don't expect me to go into details, pros and cons, I will just share the photos that I took with this lens on my Nikon D3300 camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sammer

customer_reviews.title: ok lens
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for. It's better than similar Canon lens, but it's a rather low bar to overcome. The lens is soft wide open: low resolution, low contrast, spherical aberration. Not surprising as it's a typical double-gauss design, no special glass. On the other hand the bokeh looks rather good, no nervousness, little loca. It's not a bad lens for portraits. It becomes very good at f/4, but that's not why you would buy a fast prime for. I used it on Z6, but decided to pay a bit more and get far superior Z 50mm f/1.8 S lens.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Smart

customer_reviews.title: But I just love the bokeh on this lenses
customer_reviews.text: Bokeh. That's all I've got to say. Okay, okay, I have more to say. But I just love the bokeh on this lenses. I got this lens to start taking headshots. At nights, I do nightclub photography. I've been getting request to take portfolio headshots by a few guest. I hope to master this style, before I officially start taking clients.
customer_reviews.author: E Francois

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I started out with the Nikon D3300 Kit lens, which is a nice lens also, but I was missing a strong bokeh in my photos. After some research, this sounded like the right lens for me. The quality that this lens produces was exactly what I was looking for to take my photos to the next level. The photos are very sharp and the bokeh is amazing. As other comments have said, I do notice that this lens is not ideal for landscape photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: This lens is a great value if you need it for a more modern ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens with a Nikon D750. I also own a D500 that I use for bird photography but this lens isn't practical for that. I wanted a fast lens for low light situations and some landscape photography but, didn't want to spend a fortune on the 1.4 lens. This lens is a great value if you need it for a more modern camera that can take advantage of it's features. I especially like how fast my D750 can focus with this lens even in low light. And, it can focus from less that 1.5 feet. This is an awesome lens for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Flinn

customer_reviews.title: Don't let a fixed focal length lens scare you off
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for what I needed. I do close up concert photography and this is great in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Jrose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: I have a DX format camera (Nikon d5600), so it's not the best one to use indoors. I think because of the crop factor, the effective focal length is almost 80mm, so using it indoor is a bit hard, as things appear little more zoomed in with the crop sensor. Outside, it works great, as I can always move back to take the frame I want. Works great in low light conditions. Recommend it to everyone. If you have a DX format camera and want to take pictures lots of pictures indoor, probably 35 mm one is great, but I think this one is a must have lens for nikon cameras.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I wanted, but I won't ever get rid of it.
customer_reviews.text: i'm a beginner photographer, so I apologize I don't have anything technical or fancy to say. I enjoy the lens a lot. It actually wasn't what I originally wanted because I personally don't like having to stand so far away because I'm usually indoors. But outside this thing is AMAZING. I use it on my D3200 and my D7200 and I love the way it feels, I like the overriding manual focus, and its a wonderful lens completely affordable from Nikon. It was an adjustment, but I love it and will continue to use it. I usually leave it my camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for low light and landscape
customer_reviews.text: This is not a zoom lens, it is fixed. I could only purchase one lens for my trip to Ireland and this was it. I'm very pleased with the photos I was able to capture. It also took great pics in low light settings without the flash. (at least I liked them) However, I had great difficulty inside the castle walls of getting a pic of a castle. I could only get portions of it and I had to be at a distance to get it in its entirety which can be seen above as an example.
customer_reviews.author: cece

customer_reviews.title: Almost don't need anything else
customer_reviews.text: As hobbyist photographer, this lens is perfect for everyday shooting. The telescoping lens that came with my Nikon was okay, but since getting the 50mm, I use it 99% of the time. The lens lets in a lot of light, so pictures are beautiful in sunlight or very low-light conditions. The automatic features are super handy, so I can control everything on the lens through the camera. And, easily my favorite feature and primary reason for buying the lens: the aperture settings are awesome. With this lens, I feel like I have complete control over the focus of my pictures and can blur out everything unimportant. This IS my go-to.
customer_reviews.author: Set Free

customer_reviews.title: The Neary-Everything Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband’s birthday since we had just purchased the Nikon D850 and it’s fantastic. I was between this and the 1.4, however after a lot of research, this does everything we need for a fraction of the cost and has been the lens we use for virtually everything. While we are still learning, this will definitely be a lens that we will regularly use for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: MissBritt

customer_reviews.title: My first prime lens
customer_reviews.text: I got this after reading a number of reviews. I had debated between this and the f/1.4 but settled on this. I am very new to photography and had previously only used the kit lenses that came with my camera. The quality difference was amazing. I couldn't be happier as a casual photographer. I am not just happy with the lens but also now more aware of what you can get when you spend a little extra on something higher quality. Very good lens.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: I bought this lens after Christmas because it was priced great and has such wonderful reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm a complete amateur learning to use my NikonD5300. I bought this lens after Christmas because it was priced great and has such wonderful reviews, even for beginners. Straight out of the box I was able to get the beautiful bokeh that I had been attempting (and failing) with my kit and zoom lenses. Not being able to zoom is something that I'm having to get used to, but the lens is everything it says plus more.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: Hot diggity dog.. I am so happy right now.. these pictures are not edited. Taken with my d3500
customer_reviews.author: KARADINE

customer_reviews.title: I love the quality I'm getting
customer_reviews.text: Another lens for the collection. I've had my Nikon D5100 for about 3-4 years now so I thought it was time to give myself a lens upgrade from the ones it came with (18-55mm). Still working out the specifics but I love the quality I'm getting and its so nice its able to take pictures under low light situation with better quality! It's also slightly shorter than the 18-55mm lens which will be great for traveling and it won't take up as much room.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda L.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this lens
customer_reviews.text: Worst Nikon Linz I have ever bought... It’s a piece of crap... Not sharp and they won’t let me return it
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Good lens. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: After countless reviews I read on this as a inexpensive prime lens I decided to purchase this. I accidentally purchased the 35mm (review on that too) that I kept and ordered this as originally planned as well. I liked this lens for up close photos. It doesn’t give a big area but that’s fine. I wanted a prime lens to take good portrait photographs for fun. Even though I have a 18mm-140mm it doesn’t take photographs the same as a prime lens. I recommend it if you want a good bokeh and great detail. I’m not a professional, just for fun as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Eliezer

customer_reviews.title: Have fun and take photos
customer_reviews.text: It had been awhile since I'd shot with a 50mm prime, but this lens was on sale and I picked it up for my D810. And what a joy it has been! Forget about MTF charts and pixel peeping and just go out and take photos with this little guy. Subject isolation at 1.8 is great, the lens is light and easy to carry around, and so far the results have all put smiles on my face. If you considering for critical landscape work where you need consistent sharpness from center to edge, perhaps look elsewhere, but otherwise I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Freund

customer_reviews.title: Great for Star photography
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens primarily to take photos of the night sky. The f1.8 aperture makes taking photos of the stars much easier than the lens I previously used. I do not use the auto focus feature because it will not work in the dark. However the manual mode works great.
customer_reviews.author: Larryo

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85mm and wanted something where I could get close. BOOM, this is perfect. Only thing I'll advise is keep in mind this is not 'wide angle' AT ALL. My next lens will be closer and a bit wider for some more detailed shots. This is great though, it's basically replaced my 85mm and gives me a bit more versatility in angles.
customer_reviews.author: C Mo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: All the good reviews I read on Amazon are dead on. This lens is amazing - especially for the price! I bought it for shooting in low light situations and it works perfectly. It took my photography to the next level. I love to shoot very intimate photos and low lighting helps capture the mood. So I had to add this to my collection of lenses. I’m so glad I finally did. If you’re contemplating, just buy it...you will not regret it! Thank you to everyone that posted a review because it made me feel more confident in my decision to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: T1P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens for portraits! It's a good size and weight. Pictures come out amazing! Beautiful Bokeh and cristal clear! I use it on a d3300 and it works great on DX cameras. Keep in mind the crop factor if shooting with a dx camera. It's a bit tight when shooting indoors. But outdoors you can get some nice tight portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Sensational
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful lens. Fast, crisp images and, on my 7100, a crop factor of 75mm. This is my walking around and portraiture lens. I bought one that was refurbished so as to save $50. I was nervous doing it but so far it works and shoots perfectly. Also, sometimes people who are new to photography or new to the 7100 think they can rely solely on a zoom lens. I disagree. In many ways a prime sense is more versatile than a zoom--especially when shooting in low light. And, IMHO, unless you spend a fortune on a zoom, a good prime lens will often give you a better image.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester_cat

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the price.
customer_reviews.text: PROS & CONS PROS: · The picture quality is great! · The focus is great! · The price is great CONS: · It feels cheap. The build quality isn't as good as most Nikon lenses. · It's a little abrasive when putting on the cameras. It feels like you have to turn a little harder than you should. I'm kind of surprised it's a Nikon lens, but at that price you can't expect the build quality of the higher priced lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Newton PhotoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Bustashoot.. 50(mm)makes your shot explode!
customer_reviews.text: The 50mm lens is the workhorse of the photography industry and with that said , no camera case is complete without this gem in it. The quality of photos I shoot with my Nikon using the 50mm is undeniably awesome. The 50 is like a mature woman knowing exactly what to do to please her man and unlike the 20’s and 30’s still needing more attention to find the details to bring into focus when all was needed is a good 👨🏾💼 📸. In other words... keep it short, thick and 50(mm).
customer_reviews.author: tony wheatley

customer_reviews.title: I just got it and took a couple of photos with it and the bokeh is just beautiful. It's a really fast lens
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. I took a basic photography course a year ago and bought a Nikon D5500 with a 18-140mm lens. I've been taking photographs with that lens since november 2016. Sometimes, a friend would borrow me his 50mm but it was a D version. This one... I just got it and took a couple of photos with it and the bokeh is just beautiful. It's a really fast lens. And I just love it. I will update this review on Monday after a photo shoot I have for commercial photos that my family uses for social media publicity of our flower arrangement shop. Stay tuned. But I just love this lens!
customer_reviews.author: Chucho

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Inexpensive Portrait Lens
customer_reviews.text: Essentially a 75mm lens with the DX crop factor. Great, cheap option for portrait photography but you have to move far away from your subject(s) if you want to capture surroundings. Very fast, sharp autofocus. I got this and the 35mm AF-S when they both went on sale and use the 35mm (50mm w/DX crop factor) about 5x more often. Feels like it's easier to get closer than to get farther away.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: This is a great lens for up close
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for up close. I bought this for my wife, and we didn't realize that if you want to take a picture with a lot of background this is not the lens for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for night sky shooting
customer_reviews.text: When photographing at night, you want as much light as you can get from your lens. At f1.8, this lens will help gather light for faster shots of the night sky. Especially nice for meteor showers where you want large areas of the sky and light gathering ability for those faint objects.
customer_reviews.author: C Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great Portrait Lens
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from Canon to Nikon and this was the first lens I got! It's super great for the price. I shot a wedding primarily with this lens and it was great for portraits, but I would definitely recommend an 85mm or wide angle lens for the ceremony photos so you don't have to shoot too close up. The 1.8 aperature allows for a gorgeous bokeh for portraits. Definitely a great lens for those starting out in portrait photography.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Cannell

customer_reviews.title: Superb Lens and A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: The optics are incredible! This works as advertised and it is very easy to carry around as it weighs close to nothing, but that a little weight would not matter. As for the build quality, I wish it was weather-sealed but that to me is a minor issue. That is why I give this 4/5 stars but otherwise, the build quality is fine even though some people might fret because of the plastic build. Plastic it is, but it is NOT low quality plastic. Unless, you intend to drop this onto concrete, you have nothing to worry about. Again, this lens is razor sharp and it makes for excellent panoramic shots and portraits, shoulder length and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Grosso

customer_reviews.title: I'm growing attached to the little lens.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still adjusting to this new addition, but so far I'm loving it. I bought it for night time street photography, I might attempt some astro photography with it, and use it for some portraiture. However, I've been taking it with me and forcing myself to use it on hikes and other random walkabouts and I'm just shocked at how much I'm enjoying it. I feel like the sharpness can be a little off at times, even at an aperture above f5, but that could just be me getting used to it. Ultimately, I'm more than enthused to have this cute little 50 on my camera regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, received in  new condition, and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Hi this lens is amazing, I am using it as a first time user with a Nikon d5600 to capture my baby’s 1 year birthday celebration and it’s worth it. We ordered from Trinidad ( Caribbean) and we received it in great condition. Thanks a million
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Best Lens for Portraits
customer_reviews.text: I have been researching a good portrait lens for a while and kept reading about this one. I am so glad I purchased it, it takes beautiful pictures! It is perfect for taking family/individual pictures. This is my first fixed lens I have purchased, and it's very easy to use and get adjusted too. Very happy I bought this and would definitely recommend. I have a Nikon D5200.
customer_reviews.author: All Saints Church

customer_reviews.title: NO VR BAD PICTURES
customer_reviews.text: Unless your Nikon has in body stabilization or VR this lens will be a pain a PAIN to use, the lack of VR will irritate you and or you will have to use a tripod on most of your shoots. I use a simple D3500 and D5300 to do automotive shoots and it’s terrible for stills, just ensure you get a tripod, I’m dragging this on because I had high expectations just be cautious of these issues, especially if you do professional work that is time oriented.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN MOHAMED

customer_reviews.title: Must have lens for ALL levels of photographers
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this lens. I purchase this lens last minute as my company was heading to Atlanta to cover Imagine Music Festival a few weeks ago and immediately upon opening and taking a picture with this lens, I was amazed. I have mine mounted on a Nikon D5200 that has all the aftermarket upgrades one could want. The crispness is fantastic. Bokeh is incredible. Price is great. AND it's great in low light situations. I could go on and on about this lens but I'll just say this - if you don't have it yet, BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: Great little portrait lens for a DX nikon like the d3300/3400. You really can't beat its performance for the price, except for the 35mm brother lens, but you should have both anyway if you have a DX camera! If you don't have the 35mm f/1.8 for some reason, and you want this one instead, then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Not auto focusing
customer_reviews.text: Must have a defective lenses because it would not auto focus. The camera and the lenses is set to auto focus
customer_reviews.author: JNGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: and I can already tell this is going to be my favorite lens! It takes incredibly clear pictures and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered this for my Nikon D3400, and I can already tell this is going to be my favorite lens! It takes incredibly clear pictures and the lens has larger aperture options than the lens that came on the camera. Great lens for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my Nikon D750
customer_reviews.text: Better then the 700 dollar lens my Nikon d750 came with. I prefer this lens to alot of other lenses and the price is more then reasonable. Pictures are crisp and the lens let's just the right amount of light in especially with the hood on. I will keep this lens around forever. Thanks for making a nice lens nikon. And thankyou amazon for shipping it quickly and for shipping the real USA warranties nikon lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jdg

customer_reviews.title: auto focus
customer_reviews.text: i semi liked this lens all though its perfect fit for the nikon d 7200 camera body but it does not work in auto focus at all with the camera you have to use it in manual mode also it does not take sharp images you have to use your photoshop to make the pictures sharper looking...i do not recommend using this lens on a nikon d7200 but i would check into what uses the auto focus to work on your camera body before purchsing this type of lens.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this lens so far
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this lens so far. I am a super amateur photographer who is getting back into it after years of not holding a camera. This lens performs more like an 80mm would on a full frame camera (I'm using a crop sensor Nikon D3300 for reference.) This lens is amazing for portraits and performs very well in low light. It produces amazing bokeh at a reasonable price (especially compared to the 50mm f/1.4, which is considerably pricier.) They call it the Nifty Fifty for a reason - I have a feeling this will be staying on my camera indefinitely.
customer_reviews.author: libz

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners like myself
customer_reviews.text: Easy to achieve amazing shots as an amateur. Not so great with fitting alot into a shot or capturing things from a distance. Definitely an essential lens to have in your set.
customer_reviews.author: Sister in Christ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful lens that produces excellent boquet. Really sharp images at f/1.8 and a price that's hard to beat. The only better option if you have a Nikon body with a focus motor built-in would be the 50mm "D" version of this lens. This one might be even sharper and works with every DSLR Nikon sells regardless of the range (D3300, D5300, D7100, D500, D810). Why not get this -- especially if you're shooting APS-C and want low noise in your photos. It's a fast and clear lens that everyone should own whether you shoot APS-C or FX.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Walker

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: extremely good value for the price. very sharp and pairs very well with my d800e. I am a nikon/sony/canon shooter and own 50mm lenses for all 3 systems. not quite as sharp as the sigma 50 but it almost as good at a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Gil

customer_reviews.title: Really good lens for the price, I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a fantastic lens. If you use a cheep package lens then put this one on you will instantly see a huge clarity difference. I also have a 24mm 1.8 lens, but this 50 seems to have the best in my opinion colour saturation. The 24 tends to look a little "washed out" in comparison. YMMV though.
customer_reviews.author: BeachMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the first one I ordered. While these thread align, the lens is stiff. Meaning hard to attach. Not sure if I will keep it. I don’t want to mess up the body for my other lenses, all of which are Nikon. I am extremely disappointed with the packaging. The lens box was flopping around in the shipping box. Not the way a lens should be treated.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen T Branscome

customer_reviews.title: great lens..
customer_reviews.text: great lens but i sold it, but not because anything was wrong with it.. i am not a huge fans of prime lenses even though they have excellent image quality, i like to be able to zoom in and out, on a DX camera i took this to a car show and i had to stay way to far back from he cars to get what i wanted in the frame. great lens as far as image quality, great for street photography or portraits or anything else you may want to shoot that you can a distance away from what ever your shooting. i mainly shoot cars or wildlife and well this was not ideal for either IMO
customer_reviews.author: daniel  caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Has not disappointed me yet.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this 50mm lens on cropped sensor camera bodies since March of 2016. This is my primary portrait lens as the focal length on my cameras is equivalent to 75mm which is close enough to 85mm for me. I took away 1-star because of the chromatic abbreviation (fringing). My 35mm does the same.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great lens and fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great 50mm lens, fyi the the S in the AF-S stands for silent when auto focusing. Also for those that do not know the auto focusing mechanism is built into the lens body and not using the mechanism that is inside the camera's body giving you a quicker focus. Delivery was very fast and would definitely recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jay O.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've had a chance to play around with this for a couple months now. I was hesitant since this was a refurbished item. But it works like a charm! I took a great deal of photos of my friends with this. I won't post them since I don't want to violate their privacy. Here are some non-portrait photos though. These are not edited so they appear darker but it is my preference to shoot darker and then edit them later.
customer_reviews.author: M. Le

customer_reviews.title: This is a lens every photographer needs!
customer_reviews.text: Great Lens for the Nikon DSLR D3400! Love it. Gets your a crystal clear image and the look of a professional photographer. Auto focus works. Goes all the way to f/16 - f/1.8. This is a lens every photographer needs! Thank you guys!
customer_reviews.author: EST. LEE DISPLAY L D 1902

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portrait lens!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Nikon 50mm FX lens. Currently, I am running it on a DX format camera. That smaller sensor crops the image, so just know that if you buy this, it has a DX equivalent closer to 75-80mm. This will be a great addition to anyone's tool box. Perfect for portraiture, excellent depth of field.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results for close ups and people pics
customer_reviews.text: I don't do review very often but I am so impressed with this lens and the results, I decided I needed to do this. I have two other lenses for my Nikon but I rarely used them as it made the camera so bulky and the photo quality was no better than my smaller cameras. This lens made all the difference in quality and color and it less bulky to carry around
customer_reviews.author: marypoole

customer_reviews.title: Love love the bokeh
customer_reviews.text: Creates beautiful photos and great bokeh effect! Auto focusing with this is a snap! Manual focus is great too. I absolutely am in love with this lens!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for the perfect lense to make your photography go to the NEXT ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for the perfect lense to make your photography go to the NEXT LEVEL, then HERE IT IS. First photoshoot I had with this camera, and it's made my photos look so much more crisp. The focus takes a wee bit of getting used to and the F-stop takes some adjusting, but it's SO much easier to shoot in lower light with this baby. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for portraits and filming videos of interviews. I went with the 1.8 since it actually got slightly better Amazon reviews over the 1.4 yet costs about half as much. This lens is reasonably "fast" so you can have background blur to draw attention to your subject. The lens is small and light--easily fits into a camera bag to take with you. The price is reasonable for Nikon quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stan57Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lens right now!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens, but it does take some practice because there is no zoom, and the focus is so sharp that I can have the tip of someones nose in focus and the rest of their face blurry if I don't get the setting right. I am enjoying the lens and I like that it causes me to better learn the settings on my camera. My photos seem to have a more artsy/professional look because of the nice bokeh that comes with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: the.days

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: This is my first prime lens as an amateur photographer. I've been pining over this for years and when the price dropped to 180 bucks, I knew I had to swoop in to buy it. It legitimately makes all your photos prettier. I couldn't believe the difference it made between these lens and the kit lens. With kit lens, I would have to edit post with lightroom, but with this lens everything already looks like its been edited. A+,would buy again. Don't get the amazon polarizer though, it sucks. Save your money and buy a legit one.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how this inexpensive lens has turned out to be my favorite... And I have some pretty nice lenses! Perfect for portrait, close up and scenery. The pictures are sharp and clear. And the lens is light weight which I love! I like this lens so much that I bought one for Friend!
customer_reviews.author: terrie

customer_reviews.title: Great lens -
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I can say negative (no pun intended) about this lens. I wish I had purchased it 5 years ago. It is typical Nikon excellent quality and photos are as expected - excellent. The price on Amazon is practically impossible to beat. Highly recommend sticking with brand names when possible. At this price that was a easy decision.
customer_reviews.author: ZeightyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens but takes practice to perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It rarely leaves my camera. However, if you’re coming from a kit lens.. it will take a bit of getting used to and it will take a bit of trial and error to get sharp images. Here are my tips for shooting portraits with this lens: Never shoot below 125 shutter speed. Your images will be sharper at the higher ss. Your shutter speed should always double your focal length anyway. Be mindful of your DOF at 1.8f as your DOF will be smaller when shooting wide open. This lens will still give nice bokeh at 2.5f.
customer_reviews.author: Chasity M.

customer_reviews.title: You're in the right place
customer_reviews.text: Looking into getting this lens 50mm f1.8g? Well, you're in the right place. Bought this lens recently and I AM JUST IN LOVE!! Lens is so clear, bright and crispy, the depth of field is so shallow making the background out of focus, soft and creamy...!! Mhh...I feel like a pro and I just bought my first camera!! If you want to take your photography to the next level? Well, go no further!! Disclaimer; after you see what this lens does, you will dispose your kit lens!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mairu

customer_reviews.title: Very good, not perfect, on D810
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as sharp wide open as I'd hoped, but it's at least usable at f2.0. My 50 1.8D is unusable until f2.8++. This cleans up much more quickly and is much better wide open to boot. I think stopped down the 1.8D is a bit sharper than this 1.8G, but the difference is minor. Using on a D800/D810, so on other cameras it would probably be very sharp wide open. I'm happy with the lens. It's definitely a step up from the 50 1.8D. And in my tests looks very much like DxOLabs said it would on the D800E (closest they have to my D810).
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This has become my workhorse. I love this lens. A Nikkor lenses go, it is very inexpensive. But the photos it produces are outstanding. I use it on my D7100 which makes it a 75mm (so it acts like a small telephoto lens) but has allowed me to take very nice portraits as well as landscape shots thanks to its speed. I can’t recommend this lens enough.
customer_reviews.author: R. Layne

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly a little skeptical at first, but I’m extremely happy with this purchase. This is a great lens for portrait and close up shots. I’m a beginner photographer, and I found it very easy to navigate. I believe every photographer needs this lens in their toolbox. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: S.D

customer_reviews.title: if you are on a budget and are deciding on ...
customer_reviews.text: if you are on a budget and are deciding on getting this or the 1.4 version, i would say get this. This lens yields quality optics and the bokeh is not much different from the other version imho. for me, not worth the extra hundreds of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Arren

customer_reviews.title: Favorite lens to date
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lens! The indoor and dark lighting capabilities have blown me away. I use this lens more than any other and am always thrilled with the results. It's hard to believe you can buy a lens that is this great for such a low price. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Connor Maser

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 1.4 Version
customer_reviews.text: I like this lens as much as the 1.4 G I had, they feel and look pretty similar. Wide open the portrait bokeh is nice with a little overall veiling flare and softness but it clears as soon as you stop down half a stop. Seems silly to pay more for a 1.4 lens that does the same thing (also soft wide open). I love this as a portrait lens on a DX body. The older D lenses might focus a tad quicker but the quieter, smoother AF action of the G lenses is nicer overall.
customer_reviews.author: F. Petronio

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This lens blew me away. For around $200 I was expecting an okay lens. This 50mm lens is great for portraits and a walk around lens. Excellent color, contrast and sharpness. Did not see softness around edges. I see bad reviews claiming this lens has focus issues. I tried both manual and auto. In auto it is quick to focus and spot on. Other reviews state it front focused a lot. I do not have that problem. In manual mode the focusing is also dead on. This is used in my photo shoots when space is limited. I figured for the price I'll try it. I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: starsky costello

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. It is my new go-to. Keep in mind, however that it is a 50mm and a fixed length, so the only way to zoom is by moving closer or further away from the subject. But if you're looking for a low aperture lens for low-light settings, this is a great little starter lens that's not too expensive. Would recommend if you're on a budget for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Alane Clark

customer_reviews.title: My best lens by far
customer_reviews.text: My best lens by far! 50 it's the one! No distorsion, great light, amazing boke! I'm an enthusiast 1.8 it's the best: light weight & cheap. The 1.4 costs & weights the double. The bes camera & lens it's the one U got with you all the time! I use if with a Full-frame Nikon D600 no regrets with the combo. carrie it with me always
customer_reviews.author: C. JIMENEZ

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I heard that once you buy your ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I heard that once you buy your first 50mm or lower, a new world opens to you in photography, and it's true! This lens is almost good at anything since it's so small yet so versatile anywhere you go. You just need to experiment and make it work. I'll eventually jump to a f/1.4 or f/1.2 but for now this lens it's just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Ramses Marin

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.....but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Just keep in mind when you're buying This lens its a $200 lens.... For the price it's not terrible I guess massive amounts of vignette and mine right out of the box required a lot of fine tuning as far as focusing distance goes
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: High image quality low price.
customer_reviews.text: I did my homework on this before I bought it, a low price near 200 with superb image quality. I was specifically looking for the best quality with the aperture open all the way. Based on the testing on dxomark.com This lens is on par if not better than its far more expensive Nikon f1.4. The Sigma 50mm should be a little better wide open but it's about 3 times the price so this is the best value out there. Also, mine came with a protective pouch even though I ordered just the lends, thank you amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Recommended - you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is my first 50mm prime lens. I purchased this during the black friday sale, so I was excited about the great deal. Super happy with the glass. Would definitely recommend the af-s model if you're in between. It's worth it. Sharp focus, nice photos. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla H

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! Bought it for my Nikon D750 and the quality of my images are out of this world. I really enjoy this lens! There isn’t any distortion on the outer edges when using a lower f stop, and it creates the most beautiful bokeh in my photos. I would definitely recommend this lens to anyone interested! It was definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: lindy92

customer_reviews.title: Great lense for portraits and most of the items
customer_reviews.text: I have a bit problem with taking flowers pictures esp. outside, I find it almost overexposed, too milky, please use the shield, helps to cut down the glare. Also, the autofocus distance is almost 0.42 m or so. that is quite far, would like to be able to come closer. Otherwise no VR, I believe. Great for portraits, isolates the subject from the background.
customer_reviews.author: hana

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, cheap lens!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this lens! It is SOOO cheap for the amazing quality it produces! For reference, I use this on a Nikon D7500. This lens is amazing for portraits! It is very sharp and has great bokeh!! This is definitely a portraits lens or if you want to take some decent close up pictures of animals, plants, etc. I use this lens as my prime lens! I will say, it’s not the best for landscape. Obviously, for landscape you will want to purchase a wide angle lens between 10-35 mm. But, this is definitely amazing for portraits!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase that I have made so far for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase that I have made so far for my Nikon D3400!! As a complete amateur starting out just mainly wanting to take portraits of my wife and baby this is the perfect lens! The bokeh (blurred backgrounds) is much better than the 18-55 kit lens that came with my camera. Focus is relatively quiet and fast, and images come out really sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Mal function
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens a few months ago. I own other Nikkor lenses and I have been using them for years, and they are still working great. This one however, mal functions. It works half of the time. When mount half of the time it works half of the time I have to remove it and mount again to make it work. I photograph weddings and this is very frustrating! I don't have the luxury of time to deal with this mal function. Also when I purchased it, it did not state "Factory refurbished". I purchased with the idea that was a brand new product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for my Nikon D5600. I am absolutely loving the quality of this lens. I plan on doing a friends wedding in October and wanted some quality photos. I am by no means a photographer, just a hobby I recently picked up.
customer_reviews.author: Kamia Moir

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This lens is awesome. I’ve only really used the stock lens that came with my Nikon which was 18-55mm. But wow this lens blows it out of the water. Every picture I take makes it looks professional. It was a bit pricey but I love the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Prime Lens
customer_reviews.text: I use this in conjunction with my D7500, and couldn’t be happier. It is my go-to lens for individual (and family) photography. At f/1.8, it offers beautiful bokeh, and is quite sharp. For the price, you simply won’t find a better 50mm prime lens. Another superb product from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I can see why they call it "nifty fifty"
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it makes an amateur photographer look amazing. It takes nothing to achieve bokeh like professionals. I use it on my D3200 and it works very well. If you take many indoor, portrait shots, this is your camera. I take more outdoor shots, so I would have been better with the 35mm 1.8d. Getting used to prime lenses is tricky but worth it for achieving the next photography level.
customer_reviews.author: Alper Gunduz

customer_reviews.title: and I'm very satisfied. The F-stop range so far has covered the ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of research went into selecting this lens, and I'm very satisfied. The F-stop range so far has covered the full range that I've wanted, and the focusing mechanism is almost impossibly quiet. The aspherical lens (as opposed to plano-convex) is smaller, so a bit less light comes in, but it's totally worth it to avoid any chromatic abberations (as I had seen on a different lens). Therefore it's also quite light. I HIGHLY recommend this lens to anyone just starting out with a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: If you’re on the fence, hop off and purchase the lens
customer_reviews.text: Honestly there’s nothing not amazing about this lens. It’s your standard nifty fifty. It does a great job and if you know what you’re doing, it leaves minimal work for you to do in Lightroom. Absolute game changer from the kit lens your body comes with
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A must have lens for photographers of all skill levels
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic lens, works in extremely low light and the photos are sharp. The lens itself is very light which is great for carrying around. I used it for portraits and landscapes over the past weekend and the results are just amazing. I have a 40mm 2.8 lens and this one blows that one away in crisp, sharp and dramatic images. It is just so versatile that I will always have this lens on one of my cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens for me
customer_reviews.text: This takes beautiful photos on my Nikon D750. It’s my favorite lens so far! I love it. Auto focus is spot on and it’s super fast. I was able to get great action shots of my 3 dogs running in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: Fast lens at a good price point
customer_reviews.text: The title pretty much says it all. Have not done any testing. there are plenty of reviews from pros/pros like. I like how fast of this lens and vivid color image it produce. It is a great value and must-have for DX body.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yang

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G Lens
product_meta.description: Style:Lens OnlyWhat’s in the box: Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G Lens, 58mm Snap-On Lens Cap, LF-4 Rear Lens Cap, HB-47 Bayonet Lens Hood for AF-S 50mm f/1.4G, CL-1013 Soft Lens Case, 5-Year Warranty (1-Year International + 4-Year USA Extension).
feature_bullets: Fast, upgraded f/1.8, compact FX format prime lens. The picture angle with 35 millimeter (135) format is 47 degree and the maximum reproduction ratio is 0.15X
Focal length 50 millimeter, minimum focus distance 1.48 feet (0.45 meter)
Newly developed optical system with aspherical lens element, exclusive Nikon silent wave motor (SWM)
M/a focus mode switch, filter thread 58 millimeter, autofocus: Yes. Dimensions (approx.) (from the camera lens mounting flange): Approximately 2.83 inches diameter x 2.01 inches
Optimized for edge to edge sharpness on both fx and dx format d SLRS

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars6,384 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
